If abnormality at follow-up: ultrasound up to 3 months, X-ray from the 4th month (3 months completed).
<references />

question.title: What is the recommended imaging follow-up for a child with suspected congenital hip dislocation?
question.description: A child is suspected of having congenital hip dislocation. What is the recommended imaging follow-up?

option_a.title: Ultrasound only
option_a.description: The child should only undergo an ultrasound to diagnose the condition.

option_b.title: X-ray only after 6 months
option_b.description: The child should only undergo an X-ray after 6 months of age to diagnose the condition.

option_c.title: Ultrasound up to 3 months, X-ray from the 4th month
option_c.description: The child should undergo an ultrasound up to 3 months of age and an X-ray from the 4th month of age to diagnose the condition.

option_d.title: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) only
option_d.description: The child should only undergo an MRI to diagnose the condition.

correct_option.title: Correct Option
correct_option.description: The correct option letter (A, B, C, or D)
